channel.title: Update Wiki Chat
channel.description:
I do not understand why Dino-IM is the main Instant Messenger Chat recommendation, specially having in mind following [issues](https://forums.whonix.org/t/dino-im-messenger/7773/37). It is more than clear than developers only want to accept servers with SRV records and they won't update it to support jabber servers fully under hidden services. Also it is just my personal opinion of course, but once Gajim 1.4 is released it will be the best UX
I am aware that Whonix does not document or install by default software programs that are not in `packages.debian.org` but at least should be a mention/footnote to [Ricochet-Refresh](https://github.com/blueprint-freespeech/ricochet-refresh) and [Nheko-Reborn](https://github.com/Nheko-Reborn/nheko), both forks are maintained and both work in Whonix 16 (I tested both)
And I just want to mention that installing CopyIM using their last release works in Whonix 16 (I did not try to build it) and although they say the program is in the bullseye, it is not
@Patrick is it possible to include that information in the wiki? Thanks

item.title: Update Wiki Chat
item.dc:creator: 0x1f
item.description:
I know this is old but I am willing to maintain a fork of CoyIM and think it should be default jabber client instead of Gajim for following reasons:

  • CoyIM has smaller code base
  • CoyIM is written in memory-safe and really fast language
  • CoyIM uses and enforces OTR by default, OTR is better than OMEMO for many reasons That I can’t post here because list would be too long

Not to mention Gajim and their alike do not support OTR for unknown reasons

item.title: Update Wiki Chat
item.dc:creator: IMV
item.description:
acis:

once Gajim 1.4 is released it will be the best UX

This is nice idea. The last version is Gajim 1.4.3. But you will receive old 1.3.1 via install from Debian:

sudo apt-get install gajim gajim-omemo

And you could explore Psi. I tested it on Whonix 15. Psi worked well with GPA/GPG/PGP after following commands:

sudo apt install psi-plus
sudo apt-get install libsasl2-modules
